body_content.explanation: especially in the past, a person who takes part in the activity of going from house to house at Christmas time singing carols (= Christmas songs), traditionally drinking wassail (= warm beer or wine with spices added):
examples: As alcohol was involved, wassailers often got too rowdy.

body_content.explanation: a person who took part in a ceremony at Christmas time in the past when wassail (= warm beer or wine with spices added)was poured on the trees in an orchard (= an area of land where fruit trees are grown) in order to encourage the trees to produce a good crop the next year:
examples: Cider is poured over the roots of the tree and the wassailers circle the tree chanting: Stand fast root, bear well top.
